name: Seaflight Technologies
headline: We make the world's most efficient aircraft
description:
Seaflight Technologies has developed a new form of Aerodynamic Flow Control for electrified aircraft that increases range and payload by 30%. That's the same performance improvement you'd get from hopping in a DeLorean to 2035 and coming back with batteries from the future. But it's available today - our tech has been derisked by testing supported by the National Science Foundation, the US Air Force, and the Australian Government. 

Our first product is a simple fixed-wing large cargo drone that is efficient enough to remove the "green penalty" currently associated with electric aviation. That's a step change from today's conventional platforms.  

First generation electric aircraft are heavy, expensive, complicated, and limited in terms of range and payload. In the entire history of aviation, that's never been a winning formula. When everyone already has access to the same batteries, materials, and motors, what really makes the difference? The answer is revolutionary aerodynamics, but in a form factor that suits today's operations and manufacturing. 

Beyond our own drone product line, we have partners across Aerospace helping incorporate our tech into their products. In the future, if you want to have the most efficient and cost-effective flying machine of any description, you'll need Seaflight's Flow Control inside.

founders.name: Graham Doig, Founder
founders.description: Graham Doig, founder/CEO of Seaflight Technologies, has >18 years experience across aerospace and automotive, and in academia with over 90 technical papers to his name as a Lockheed Martin-endowed professor. After his PhD on the aerodynamics of low altitude flight, he led the aero/range team at EV startup Canoo from early through SPAC, and conducted funded research programs with NASA, Tesla, and Joby Aviation. He designed 2 solar-electric vehicles which set international land speed records.

# This is how a new layer in logistics is born. 
Seaflight's electric drones are the first to offer the range, payload and affordability to deliver same-day air cargo with no green premium.
![Seaflight's long range electric cargo drone](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_a5d5e247e9b646baba8d0c3af5c5c665~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_1080,h_1062,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,enc_avif,quality_auto/d960a7_a5d5e247e9b646baba8d0c3af5c5c665~mv2.jpg)
The AURAE electric cargo drone 
Up to 800km / 500 mi of range
Space for three pallets
Operate from rough fields less than 400ft
## Aviation needs to decarbonize. 
But upcoming first generation electric aircraft are
​
heavy
expensive
complicated
range limited 
​
​
...in the entire history of flight, this has never been a winning formula.
## Radical efficiency is the key.
When everyone has access to the same batteries, motors, and materials, what can really make the difference to range and payload? 
​
​
Drone Deliverywith Seaflight60 min00:30
![Seaflight's Aurae long range electric cargo drone flies over the Australian outback](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_c58012202f014996875dc48ad2198550~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_97,h_70,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/outback_nologo.jpg)
Revolutionary aerodynamics.
Seaflight brings step-change aerodynamic efficiency to simple form factors that suit today's operations and manufacturing techniques. 
No other miracles needed.
## An aerodynamic breakthrough
Seaflight has developed an aerodynamic flow control system that works for any fixed wing aircraft, but is especially suited to electric and hybrid platforms. It makes ultra-high lift when needed, and ultra-efficiency the rest of the time. 
It's proven technology, going first into our drones, then larger aircraft built by us and our customers. 
​
And you don't need to just take our word for it. 
Our R&D was backed by :
[![seed_edited_edited.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_898b28f487f84186a840808cf405f931~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_55,h_13,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/seed_edited_edited.png)](https://www.seaflight.tech/<http:/www.nsf.gov>)
[![USAF_edited_edited.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_b6512b9502b44b1da4d1a7cfc2726b25~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_55,h_18,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/USAF_edited_edited.png)](https://www.seaflight.tech/<http:/www.afwerx.com>)
[![DoITRDCA_Inline_high_res_png_edited.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_c2ca9550827e47ed85d1280fe5d6cc84~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_71,h_13,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/DoITRDCA_Inline_high_res_png_edited.png)](https://www.seaflight.tech/<https:/www.industry.gov.au/>)
01
Helping the air work harder
![graphic1.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_3019ab6006d4454c82401b50b9049302~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_185,h_138,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_3,enc_avif,quality_auto/graphic1.png)
Seaflight's Aerodynamic Flow Control energizes the air flowing over the wings, helping it stay attached at angles that would otherwise be impossible
02
Ultra-short takeoff and landing
Flow control means high lift is generated at takeoff and landing, so extreme short field operations are possible without the cost, mass and complexity of adding more propulsion.
![graphic2.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_bb04d628fbab494583f652f1ad6c343c~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_96,h_34,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/graphic2.png)
03
Wings normally have to be large for takeoff, whether by themselves or with heavy multi-element flap arrangements. With our lightweight flow control, the wings can now be slim and high aspect-ratio, dramatically improving cruise range thanks to reduced drag.
![graphic3.png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_5c1e212470484e93a4f50f6de6693a4d~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_140,h_135,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_3,enc_avif,quality_auto/graphic3.png)
Seriously efficient cruise
## The latest
![Johan Seaflight Wind Tunnel Test.jpg](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/d960a7_cd0a9f8ce8954b53b0b7be1391dfd2c6~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_85,h_71,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/d960a7_cd0a9f8ce8954b53b0b7be1391dfd2c6~mv2.jpg)
[Seaflight completes wind tunnel testing at Caltech](https://www.seaflight.tech/<https:/www.seaflight.tech/news>)
[July 2024](https://www.seaflight.tech/<https:/www.seaflight.tech/news>)
##  About Seaflight
## Seaflight Technologies was founded in 2022 on the way in to Y Combinator, with a mission to accelerate an electric and equitable future for aviation. 
## Backed by world-class venture.

generated_description:
Seaflight Technologies, founded in 2022 and currently part of Y Combinator's S22 batch, is on a mission to revolutionize aviation by creating the world's most efficient aircraft. Based in Carson, California, Seaflight has developed an innovative Aerodynamic Flow Control technology that enhances the range and payload of electrified aircraft by an impressive 30%. Think of it as borrowing a time machine's advantage—like bringing back futuristic batteries—except it's here and ready to deploy.

Their flagship product is the AURAE, a fixed-wing cargo drone designed to eliminate the "green penalty" often associated with electric aviation. Unlike first-generation electric aircraft that tend to be heavy, expensive, and limited in capacity, Seaflight’s drones offer a step-change in performance. They’re built to work smarter, not harder, leveraging revolutionary aerodynamics to maximize efficiency. This approach makes Seaflight’s drones capable of same-day air cargo delivery—without the environmental drawbacks.

Seaflight isn’t just stopping at its drone. The company is collaborating with partners throughout the aerospace industry to embed its groundbreaking aerodynamic technology into various aircraft, shaping a future where efficiency is paramount in both design and operation.

With a small but mighty team of four, under the mentorship of Jared Friedman, Seaflight is set on a path toward achieving its ambitious vision. If you want to follow their journey and learn more about their technology, you can check them out at [Seaflight Technologies](https://www.seaflight.tech).

In summary, Seaflight Technologies is tackling the future of aviation head-on, making strides toward a more sustainable and efficient airborne logistics landscape. They believe that with the right aerodynamics, the skies aren't the limit—they're just the beginning.
